atDirectives.name: @tailwind
atDirectives.description: Use the `@tailwind` directive to insert Tailwind's `base`, `components`, `utilities` and `screens` styles into your CSS.

atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: Use `@apply` to inline any existing utility classes into your own custom CSS.

atDirectives.name: @layer
atDirectives.description: Use the `@layer` directive to tell Tailwind which 'bucket' a set of custom styles belong to.

atDirectives.name: @theme
atDirectives.description: Tailwind v4: Use `@theme` to define your design tokens (colors, spacing, fonts, etc.) directly in CSS.

atDirectives.name: @source
atDirectives.description: Tailwind v4: Use `@source` to specify additional source files for Tailwind to scan for class names.

atDirectives.name: @custom-variant
atDirectives.description: Tailwind v4: Use `@custom-variant` to define a custom variant (like `dark`, `hover`, etc.) with a custom CSS selector.

atDirectives.name: @variant
atDirectives.description: Tailwind v4: Use `@variant` to apply a Tailwind variant to styles inside a block.

atDirectives.name: @utility
atDirectives.description: Tailwind v4: Use `@utility` to define a custom utility class.

atDirectives.name: @import
atDirectives.description: Standard CSS @import, also used by Tailwind v4 to import framework CSS.
